article: "Remember, your father is only one year older than you." That was Mom's usual excuse when Dad said the _ things or did something foolish. Dad _ drinking exactly one year before I was born.He _ a group of other people who had also stopped drinking.I loved my dad but I _ the way his weekly meetings took him away from me.It seemed they were more _ to him than I was.But with my _ coming up I thought Dad would make an exception."Can" t you _ it just this time? Saturday is my birthday! " I begged him.He _ , "I'm chairing the meeting this Saturday.We will have your party on Sunday." Saturday evening I sat on my bed, feeling _ for myself.Dad started to leave, then _ and said, "Why not come with me tonight? It' s an open meeting.All are _ ." What would I do at a meeting? But maybe I needed to see why something Dad did every week _ so much. After we arrived, Dad announced the _ of the meeting was going to be gratitude."Today I'm _ seventeen years of stopping drinking, " he continued."One year after quitting drinking I received the most _ gift of my life, my daughter.I'm so grateful that she has _ seen me drunk." Shame washed over me. Later, a man called Dave also told his _ .Only then did I know it was Dad that saved his life from drinking.Dad was the _ he was at the meeting that day.Showing up week after week and _ with people, Dad was changing lives.I was so _ of him.
